Module org.microbean.interceptor
Package org.microbean.interceptor

Class Interception

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.interceptor.Interception
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Callable<Object>
    public final class Interception
extends Object
implements Callable<Object>
    An interception of a construction event, another lifecycle event, or a general purpose method or function.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    call(), InvocationContext

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interception

        public Interception​(Collection<? extends InterceptorMethod> interceptorMethods,
                    Supplier<?> targetBootstrap)
        Creates a new Interception that performs lifecycle event interceptions.

        If this constructor is used, an invocation of the call() method will return the value of an invocation of the supplied targetBootstrap's get() method, or null if the supplied targetBootstrap is, or returns, null.

        Parameters:
        interceptorMethods - a Collection of InterceptorMethods; may, rather uselessly, be null or empty
        targetBootstrap - a Supplier of the target instance for which a lifecycle event has occurred; may, rather uselessly, be null, and may, rather uselessly, return null
        See Also:
        call()

      • Interception

        public Interception​(Collection<? extends InterceptorMethod> interceptorMethods,
                    Constructor<?> constructor)
             throws IllegalAccessException
        Creates a new Interception that performs around-construct interceptions.

        If this constructor is used, an invocation of the call() method will return the value of an invocation of the supplied Constructor's newInstance(Object...) method.

        Parameters:
        interceptorMethods - a Collection of InterceptorMethods; may, rather uselessly, be null
        constructor - the Constructor being intercepted; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if constructor is null
        IllegalAccessException - if unreflecting fails
        See Also:
        call(), terminalFunctionOf(Constructor)

      • Interception

        public Interception​(Collection<? extends InterceptorMethod> interceptorMethods,
                    Constructor<?> constructor,
                    Supplier<? extends Object[]> argumentsBootstrap)
             throws IllegalAccessException
        Creates a new Interception that performs around-construct interceptions.

        If this constructor is used, an invocation of the call() method will return the value of an invocation of the supplied Constructor's newInstance(Object...) method.

        Parameters:
        interceptorMethods - a Collection of InterceptorMethods; may, rather uselessly, be null
        constructor - the Constructor being intercepted; must not be null
        argumentsBootstrap - a Supplier of initial arguments that will be supplied to the interception; may be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if constructor is null
        IllegalAccessException - if unreflecting fails
        See Also:
        call(), terminalFunctionOf(Constructor)

      • Interception

        public Interception​(Collection<? extends InterceptorMethod> interceptorMethods,
                    Function<? super Object[],​?> terminalFunction,
                    Supplier<? extends Object[]> argumentsBootstrap)
        Creates a new Interception that performs around-construct interceptions.

        If this constructor is used, an invocation of the call() method will return the value of an invocation of the supplied terminalFunction's apply(Object[]) method, or null if the supplied terminalFunction is null

        Parameters:
        interceptorMethods - a Collection of InterceptorMethods; may, rather uselessly, be null
        terminalFunction - the terminal Function being intercepted; may, rather uselessly, be null
        argumentsBootstrap - a Supplier of initial arguments that will be supplied to the interception; may be null
        See Also:
        call()

      • Interception

        public Interception​(Collection<? extends InterceptorMethod> interceptorMethods,
                    Method method,
                    Supplier<?> targetBootstrap)
             throws IllegalAccessException
        Creates a new Interception that performs around-invoke or lifecycle event interceptions.
        Parameters:
        interceptorMethods - a Collection of InterceptorMethods; may be null if this interception is a lifecycle event interception
        method - the Method to intercept; may be null if this interception is a lifecycle event interception
        targetBootstrap - a Supplier of the target instance for the around-invoke invocation or for which a lifecycle event has occurred; may, rather uselessly, be null, and may, rather uselessly, return null; it is strongly recommended that this Supplier return a constant value
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - if unreflecting fails
        See Also:
        call()

      • Interception

        public Interception​(Collection<? extends InterceptorMethod> interceptorMethods,
                    Method method,
                    Supplier<?> targetBootstrap,
                    Supplier<? extends Object[]> argumentsBootstrap)
             throws IllegalAccessException
        Creates a new Interception that performs around-invoke or lifecycle event interceptions.
        Parameters:
        interceptorMethods - a Collection of InterceptorMethods; may be null
        method - the Method to intercept; may be null if this interception is a lifecycle event interception
        targetBootstrap - a Supplier of the target instance for the around-invoke invocation or for which a lifecycle event has occurred; may, rather uselessly, be null, and may, rather uselessly, return null; it is strongly recommended that this Supplier return a constant value
        argumentsBootstrap - a Supplier of initial arguments that will be supplied to the interception; may be null
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - if unreflecting fails
        See Also:
        call()

      • Interception

        public Interception​(Collection<? extends InterceptorMethod> interceptorMethods,
                    Function<? super Object[],​?> terminalFunction,
                    boolean aroundConstruct,
                    Supplier<?> targetBootstrap,
                    Supplier<? extends Object[]> argumentsBootstrap)
        Creates a new Interception that performs around-construct, around-invoke or lifecycle event interceptions.
        Parameters:
        interceptorMethods - a Collection of InterceptorMethods; may be null
        terminalFunction - the terminal Function being intercepted; may be null if this is a lifecycle event interception
        aroundConstruct - whether this is an around-construct interception
        targetBootstrap - a Supplier of the target instance for an around-invoke invocation or for which a lifecycle event has occurred; may, rather uselessly, be null, and may, rather uselessly, return null; ignored if aroundConstruct is true
        argumentsBootstrap - a Supplier of initial arguments that will be supplied to the interception; may be null
        See Also:
        call()

        public final Object call()
                  throws Exception
        Invokes the interception chain this Interception represents and returns the result, which may be null.
        Specified by:
        call in interface Callable<Object>
        Returns:
        the result of interception
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

        IllegalAccessException - if unreflecting fails

      • terminalFunctionOf

        public static final Function<Object[],​Object> terminalFunctionOf​(Method m,
                                                                       Supplier<?> receiverSupplier)
                                                                throws IllegalAccessException
        Creates and returns a Function encapsulating the supplied Method.
        Parameters:
        m - a Method; must not be null. If m is a virtual method, then the supplied receiverSupplier will be used to supply its receiver
        receiverSupplier - a Supplier of the receiver for the supplied Method; may be null in which case the supplied Method must be static
        Returns:
        a Function encapsulating the supplied Method; never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if m is null
        IllegalAccessException - if unreflecting fails

      • terminalFunctionOf

        public static final Function<Object[],​Object> terminalFunctionOf​(MethodHandle receiverlessMethodHandle)
        Creates and returns a Function encapsulating the supplied MethodHandle.
        Parameters:
        receiverlessMethodHandle - a MethodHandle; must not be null; must be receiverless or bound to a receiver already.
        Returns:
        a Function encapsulating the supplied MethodHandle; never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if receiverlessMethodHandle is null

      • terminalFunctionOf

        public static final Function<Object[],​Object> terminalFunctionOf​(MethodHandle mh,
                                                                       Supplier<?> receiverSupplier)
        Creates and returns a Function encapsulating the supplied MethodHandle.
        Parameters:
        mh - a MethodHandle; must not be null. If receiverSupplier is non-null, then mh must accept at least one leading argument (a receiver supplied by the supplied receiverSupplier).
        receiverSupplier - a Supplier of the receiver for the supplied MethodHandle; may be null in which case the supplied MethodHandle must be receiverless
        Returns:
        a Function encapsulating the supplied MethodHandle; never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mh is null

      • validate

        public static final void validate​(Class<?>[] parameterTypes,
                                  Object[] arguments)
        A convenience method that ensures that every element of the supplied arguments array can be assigned to a reference bearing the corresponding Class drawn from the supplied parameterTypes array.

        Boxing, unboxing and widening conversions are taken into consideration.

        This method implements the logic implied, but nowhere actually specified, by the contract of InvocationContext.setParameters(Object[]).

        Parameters:
        parameterTypes - an array of Class instances; may be null; must not contain null elements or void.class; must have a length equal to that of the supplied arguments array
        arguments - an array of Objects; may be null; must have a length equal to that of the supplied parameterTypes array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails, i.e. if the length of parameterTypes is not equal to the length of arguments, or if an element of parameterTypes is null or void.class, or if not every element of the supplied arguments array can be assigned to a reference bearing the corresponding Class drawn from the supplied parameterTypes array
